reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We first visited here 20 years ago when it was one of the boutique hotels of the Cotswolds. It still is wonderful building with lots of character but as a hotel it is not in the same league as Lords of the Manor, to choose one local rival. It is a serviceable, comfortable hotel. The service is fine but there are moments when it feels like you are in a seaside lodging house. The pool is nice but a like the rest of the hotel it is feeling a little past its best. I have to say that we paid a fraction of what it would have cost to go to the Lords of the Manor so the comparison is not strictly fair. In the end you get what you pay for. We eat in the restaurant which had some real high spots (beautifully tasty local lamb) but again compromised by some other aspects of the meal.
reviews.title: A lovely building - but not the hotel it once was

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to Charingworth Manor for a few days of relaxing and certainly found it, room very nice with own terrace looking over a fantastic vista, perfect for enjoying a glass of wine with perfect weather for October. Staff all very professional and attentive your every need catered for. Will defiantly return.
reviews.title: Relaxing break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned to this wonderful hotel for our wedding anniversary, having got married there last year. We were thoroughly spoilt and the staff very attentive and kind, and made it a very special stay, one we will certainly remember.
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is stunning and you unwind as soon as you go up the driveway, very peaceful and tranquil.
reviews.title: Loved the stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please do yourself a favour, if you want a treat, go here you won't find better service and quality.
reviews.title: Haven of peace and beauty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set in the lovely Cotswolds and surrounded by beautiful countryside.
reviews.title: Beautiful, tranquil hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I organised this night away as a special occasion for my partner.
reviews.title: Afternoon tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was The Gilbert Room with a four poster bed, it was stunning.
reviews.title: Afternoon Tea - a delight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The evening meal was amazing and restaurant staff extremely professional.
reviews.title: Beautiful Silver Wedding Celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: In the morning we really wanted to have a dip in the pool and asked the reception team if we could check out at 11.30, unfortunately this was declined as the room was booked for that evening. I was disappointed that the reception staff could not be flexible by letting us check out half an hour later so we could experience the leisure facilities, especially as I had paid over £300 for a one night stay!
reviews.title: A summer stay in the Cotswolds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having stayed here many times before, I really do view this hotel as a home from home. The perfect setting for a few nights away - Charingworth Manor is quite simply a lovely hotel with stunning views of the Cotswolds. Have a drink after breakfast at the front of the hotel and marvel at the countryside - it really couldn't get better. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel with perfect surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We keep coming back to Charingworth because we feel very much at ease there, we love the surrounding country and indeed the whole rural outlook from the hotel, and we greatly appreciate the atmosphere of the hotel. The staff we found invariably friendly and helpful. They judged well the amount of conversation with us, and we could think of nothing that would have needed to be added to make our stay more enjoyable. Our sincere thanks to Michael and all his colleagues who make this a quite exceptional hotel, and we promise to be back again without delay!
reviews.title: Fourth time even better than third time lucky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is simply marvellous. My wife and I were celebrating our Golden Wedding Anniversary and the hotel was exactly what we wished for. Quiet, beautifully situated, excellent food and staff who worked together to make our stay so memorable that we will certainly be going back in the future.
reviews.title: The Best Hidden Hotel in the Cotswolds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Today we went to this hotel for lunch and we were not disappointed. The most beautiful setting with views across wide open countryside and the interior was fabulous. Our lunch was delicious and the staff were excellent, we could not have asked for more.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely be going back and probably for an overnight stay.
reviews.title: Fabulous offer and lovely grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a two night stay here on a deal including afternoon tea and evening meals. Charingworth is a beautiful setting in which to chill out and enjoy the scenery of the Cotswolds. Afternoon Tea was a real treat, enjoyed in the character of the hotel. We also enjoyed two good quality evening meals at the hotel, highlights being the beef cheeks and duck starter. The music in the restaurant was an odd choice and a bit distracting, but staff were responsive to turning it down. We used the pool which was a great size, but it is not really a spa with no treatment rooms and poor quality sauna/steam room.
reviews.title: Beautiful Escape to the pace of modern life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is full of charm, quirk and character, nice not to be staying in a place that looks the same as every other in a chain.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, would recommend staying at this hotel as a great escape to the modern pace of life.
reviews.title: Excellent location and wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking forward to this as when I telephone the hotel the staff seemed to be very personable and the reviews very good. Booked on a solstice package which included afternoon tea but due to the 7 million caravans that seemed to be on the road we arrived just over 5 minutes late. The greeting from reception was OK but I think she must have been having a bad day as eye contact or communication seemed a bit lacking. She did (without acknowledging me) phone the chef to let him know that the 'other solstice package had arrive' and he did agree to do tea even though we were late. Glad he did as I can confirm that the Pimms jelly was superb. The room was average and we booked a deluxe. Dinner was ok but my fish had an odd bitter sauce however, my husbands food was fine. Breakfast was Good. We were always referred to by the Room name and not our name which I thought was a bit off and the service was a little officious. Personally didn't feel that it was that welcoming unlike the next hotel we stayed Flitwick Manor. But I guess horses for courses and people like different things. Think we will go back to the Cotswold House Hotel next time.
reviews.title: perfect,peaceful getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for just one night but wish it had been longer. Hotel is in a wonderful location and hotel exudes class without being pretentious. Staff are really friendly and attentive and a credit to the hotel. Afternoon tea was a delight and the Pimm's Jellies are to die for! Evening meal was also of a excellent standard and the staff made sure your wine glass was always topped up. Rooms were all of a high standard, we asked for a quick tour before we left, and the Gilbert suite that we stayed in was full of character and superbly appointed. My only regret is that we only stayed for one night. Thanks to all the staff and we look forward to staying at this wonderful hotel again soon.
reviews.title: A wonderful place and great staff
